answerText: gastrulation[10] Gastrulation first occurs at this structure, which is formed when epiblast cells undergo the "polonaise" movement. This structure forms at the posterior end but ends up becoming the anterior-posterior axis.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 9 | 7 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In the first step of this process, the anterior-posterior symmetry is broken. For 10 points each: [10] Name this process in evolutionary development, in which three germ layers form from the blastula.
